attributes.action: Add ‘RESPECT’ to the National Curriculum from 5 years upwards. Lacking Today.
attributes.background:
Many grow up with little or no respect today, no Respect for Teachers the Police, Property and the Elderly, this is very wrong in this day and age, Some Police only Get Cheek in trying to correct their behaviour and the ones above.

At one time Churches could leave them open, today it’s a No No.
attributes.additional_details:
Many youngsters are Serious Lacking Any Respect today as is Proven, Some attack Teachers and their Assistants, Elderly getting abused and Picked on, when I was young it was Instilled into us ALL at school Never to do Anything Against the Elderly and all the above, we All Respected Them 100%, we would never have thought about causing Damage or Thefts from Churches, today some do, Not all are Bad just a Select few causing Antisocial Behaviour.

Let’s try to correct things and make the Country good

attributes.action: Help single parents into work by funding childcare for all ages during holidays
attributes.background: It is really hard for single parents to work during summer holidays due to the government not funding childcare for all ages, only funding for children under 5 if you spread you nursery hours throughout the year. It is near impossible for a single parent of children under 10 to work 30 hours a week.

attributes.action: Make Staffordshire Bull terriers wear a harness or muzzle in public.
attributes.background:
My pet cat was savaged and killed by a Staffordshire bull terrier whilst the incompetent owner and his partner walked past my premises. 
The dog was not muzzled or in a harness, he was able to slip his lead and collar. The owner who had one arm in a sling at the time was unable to control him.
attributes.additional_details:
I am partially disabled and Ben is my only companion, this has had a devastating effect on my life. 
I reported the incident to the police and the Basildon Echo. 
The police are unable to do anything about it without identifying the owner. 
I have searched the neighbourhood and spoken with many local people but have been unable to find the owner. 
My MP encouraged me to start the petition and has spoken with the police on my behalf.

attributes.action: Streamline UK education by creating a single/governmental exam board
attributes.background: I'm at my 1st year of university. A lot of time is wasted covering content covered at A level; this was also true for A level regarding GCSEs. Why? Because multiple exam boards mean students don't cover the same content, so it has to be taught again at the next level of education.
attributes.additional_details:
One exam board would stop this.

Furthermore, revision resources are poor. But, converting to one exam board will create a single/larger market for people to produce educational content for, meaning it can be higher quality.

E.g. 2 At A-level, I wanted to produce a revision site for A-level STEM subjects, however it is a waste of time because too few students would use it, because there is too much content between the 5 different exam boards.

attributes.action: To have a UK referendum on the colour of the UKGB passport post Brexit.
attributes.background: The government has announced that the UK will be returning to a navy blue passport post Brexit. As Brexit is about building a new future, a return to its navy origins can be considered looking backwards. There should be a choice of colours for people to choose from to represent this new beginning.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_wheel

attributes.action: Make compassionate leave a Statutory Right With Reasonable Period off & full pay
attributes.background: compassionate leave is not offered in my contract, I researched this online and found that this is not a statutory right. If like me you work on commission and earn a low salary you will struggle financially in an emergency, I think this needs to change and people should have the right to grieve.
attributes.additional_details:
My wife's grandmother died and we had to fly to get to the funeral, upon my return I was told that I would need to use my 5 of my holiday days (I only get 20) as they didn't offer compassionate leave. I thought this was unfair and I feel that this needs to change and should be a basic right. 

gov.uk website 
"pay, your employer may pay you for time off to look after dependents but they don't have to. check your contact, company handbook or internet site to see if there are rules about this. "

attributes.action: Change delay repay minimum delay to 5 minutes.
attributes.background: Currently delay repay schemes only compensate customers who experience delays of between 15 minutes and 30 minutes. Many more customers who are regularly delayed by 5 minutes or more receive no compensation. This needs to change. Train companies need to be held to account for their mistakes/delays.

attributes.action: Do not ban 'cartoon characters' from 'unhealthy foods'.
attributes.background: MPs on the Health Committee wish to ban cartoon characters on 'unhealthy food' (such as Tony the Tiger & Nestle's Milky Bar Kid). These brand mascots have been around for decades yet obesity rates are only very high now due to bad parenting.
attributes.additional_details: Link to BBC Article - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44298135

attributes.action: Add "None of the above" to the election ballot paper.
attributes.background: With belief in MP's of all parties at an all time low, add "None of the above" to the ballot paper to remove all candidates in a constituency from standing in elections for 10 years. this may make candidates, MP's and parties more respectful and responsive to the electorate in their constituencies.
attributes.additional_details: If "None of the above" wins the ballot then all those candidate on the ballot paper would be barred from standing for office for 10 years

attributes.action: UK Government to create a scheme to help people to manage their gambling.
attributes.background: Gambling was legalised in 1961 for better government control and to allow SMALL bets to be placed. There are 450k-2million problem gamblers that effect 2-10million people in the UK. Can i suggest that the UK government considers the introduction of a 'gambling card' that will control gambling.
attributes.additional_details: I believe there is a 'conflict of interest' letting betting companies deal with 'Self exclusion' and 'Affordability checks'. Betting companies do not identify problem gamblers and there is no instructions how they could identify problem gamblers. Amounts placed and frequency is not monitored. Could the government, working with betting firms, consider a 'gambling card' be introduced based on someone's income. Gambling is not FUN if someone can lose more than they can afford to.

attributes.action: UK residents aged 16 and 17 year olds should be able to vote in referendums.
attributes.background: I think that people in the UK who were 16/17 should be able to vote in referendums. An example of this I think that 16/17 should have been able to vote in the EU referendum and weren't allowed to and leaving the EU will affect those who weren't able to vote in it, me being one of those individuals.

attributes.action: Extend the Culture Secretary's recent FOBT decision to cover online casino games
attributes.background: On 17th May, Culture Secretary Matt Hancock opted to limit stakes on FOBTs in high street Bookmakers to £2 from £100 on the grounds they are “a social blight”. The policy needs to extend to the very same games  of chance on bookmakers/casino websites, usually undertaken in a solitary environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Online 'FOBT' games offer no social interaction and less protection than the high street equivalent.

http://www.techaddiction.ca/online-gambling-casino.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2395877/A-terrifying-parable-addictive-power-internet-gambling-It-began-5-online-bet-Then-ex-Major-gambled-away-750-000--family.html

http://www.gamcare.org.uk/forum/getting-addicted-online-roulette

https://www.onlineroulette.com/guides/addictive-roulette/

attributes.action: Make Government Funds Available for Victims & Families of Terrorist Attacks
attributes.background:
I was shocked to recently learn that there is ‘No’ financial funding help for victims or their families of terrorist attacks in the U.K. 
In light of the Manchester Arena bombing, and the 22 victims, London Bridge Attack, Westminster Attack, Finsbury Park Attack in 2017 we should be helping.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Funds need to be made available for victims and their families , and those who have been affected by incidents of terrorism in the United Kingdom. There needs to be a special fund set up to help these people, and their families who need to take time off work, to look after family members, general living expenses, and specialist care.
This is the least we can do as a nation, to help people who need it the most. After experiencing such life affecting atrocities!

attributes.action: Offer all GCSE, A level and University students a mental health check
attributes.background: Lots of young adults have mental health issues and don't speak out about it and are scared to. To stop this from developing all students should have a mental health check yearly between years 10 to finishing university. This can then get all students the help that they deserve and should have.
attributes.additional_details: School is hard enough to get through and deal with during these stressful times without having disorders and everything holding you down. This can become easier through knowing who has these issues and helping them through the process.

attributes.action: Stop traumatising images on cigarette and tobacco packaging
attributes.background: The pictures are explicit pictures of children on the packaging of cigarettes and tobbaco. There is also one of an adult blowing smoke into a baby’s face. People have to look at these pictures in their everyday life and can be traumatising for many people.
attributes.additional_details: To stop the printing of child abuse and half dead children on cigarette packaging. It’s absolutely absurd that this would even be considered. Let alone commissioned within the UK. How this would benefit anyone I don’t know. It’s basically forcing people to look at these images. And should not be legal. It shows the mentality that plagues the English governing system today.

attributes.action: Ban all plastics and other non-recyclables from Christmas Crackers
attributes.background: The items in Christmas Crackers are often single use. The plastic "toys" contained in cheaper Christmas Crackers are often of inferior quality, non-functional and often thrown away on the same day they are produced. Minimum standards for Christmas Crackers should be defined to reduce waste.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for horse owners to pick up their horse droppings
attributes.background: Living in a rural village in Berkshire I often see a lot of horse pooh in the road and never once a person cleaning it up, after my 6 and 8 year old sons pointing this out, why dog owners do why don’t horse owners it is unsanitary to surely in this day and age?

attributes.action: Make the current VED rates retrospective to cars registered from 2000 onwards.
attributes.background: The current VED system is grossly unfair. Cars registered now can emit 249g of CO2 yet only pay £140 PA VED. A car registered in 2007 emitting the same CO2 pays £540 PA VED! It gets even worse though, the EXACT SAME CAR registered up to March 2006 pays £315 PA VED!
attributes.additional_details: Seeing as the whole point of the CO2 based system was for environmental reasons why are older cars not treated the same as new ones? The CO2 coming out of the exhaust is the same! This situation is actually costing the government money as owners of these cars SORN them hence ZERO tax revenue!!

attributes.action: Ban hunting for pheasants and other game birds. It is very cruel.
attributes.background: Hunting pheasants is just as bad as fox hunting in my opinion. This is a very very cruel sport. The poor birds are treated very badly and this needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: There are many videos on YouTube which show how these poor birds suffer. Why? All for the entertainment of huntsmen. How would they feel? To be shot and left for dead?

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to use lies as part of a campaign for a public vote
attributes.background: The use of lies in public campaigns is  growing

attributes.action: Update the current legislation: "The Electricity at Work Regulations 1989"
attributes.background: There exists ambiguity within the electrical industry, specifically with regard to electrical installation of equipment, with what can be considered acceptable with regard to meeting the requirements of regulations, due to the outdated and generic criteria which is open to interpretation.
attributes.additional_details:
The EaWR 1989 would benefit from an update to specifically clarify and reference the associated standards and regulations detailed below:

The Electricity at Work Regulations 1989

The Electrical Equipment (Safety) Regulations 2016

BS 7671

BS 6423

This would ensure that persons on whom duties are imposed (e.g. duty holders) have a clear and defined defence against any alleged breaches.

attributes.action: Repeal Section 127 (1) of the 2003 Communications Act. Offence is not a crime.
attributes.background:
The Communications Act states: (1) A person is guilty of an offence if he 
(a) sends by means of a public electronic communications network a message or other matter that is GROSSLY OFFENSIVE or of an indecent, obscene or menacing character.
attributes.additional_details: Clearly, this is in breach of everybody's right to Freedom of Speech. Offence is an entirely subjective concept. For the state to be able to decide what is offensive, and then prosecute accordingly is tyrannical.

attributes.action: Make anywhere serving fresh food to be required to provide free tap water.
attributes.background:
I think that any premises serving fresh food should be required to provide tap water and refill reusable water bottles up to 1ltr for free. 
This should include people who aren’t customers.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote before the UK engages with military action in Libya
attributes.background: Further to previous Middle East conflicts and their outcome, it is imperative that we have a democratic vote by elected MPs on whether the UK should be involved in an escalation of military activity in Libya

attributes.action: Legalise the permanent removal of front number plates.
attributes.background: As an avid car modifier and petrolhead, I and most people know find that the front number plates on our vehicles can really stand out more than we want and slightly ruin the look and aesthetic of the vehicle.
attributes.additional_details: The ability to permanently remove the front number plate could also reduce the risk of number plate theft by criminals as there are less possibilities. People say that it gives more opportunities for crime to be committed using the car but if the police never chase from the front so their DVLA scanners would still be able to correctly operate. The issue of speed cameras could be resolved by simply making them double sided so that they can capture criminals from both sides of the road.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of peanut products in cinemas
attributes.background: Going to the cinema can be a traumatic time for many people with a peanut/nut allergy. Spending most of the time looking around to make sure that someone next to you is not about to open a packet of Peanut M&M’s or another product containing peanuts. Families should feel safe in a place of enjoyment
attributes.additional_details:
Peanut allergies affect 1 in 55 children in the UK, why put our children at risk in a place that is suppose to be enjoyable? 
 Every cinema I have visited in the UK so far sells Peanut M&M’s as a film-time snack. Are there not enough other snacks available without the need to sell peanut based products?? 
 Nuts are in the top 3 most common food allergies in the UK to date, and with this allergy being also airborne this causes more of a danger in close public spaces such as cinemas.

attributes.action: Amend the Town and Country Planning Regulations on the flying of the EU flag
attributes.background: Under the 2007/2012 Planning Regulations flags can be flown without consent. Schedule 1 Class H allows: The flag of the Commonwealth, EU, UN, or any other international organisation of which the UK is a member. On 29/3/2019 the UK will leave the EU, hence flying the EU flag without consent must end.
attributes.additional_details:
The Town and Country Planning Regulations 2007 and amendment 2012, allows certain flags can be flown without consent, as set out within Schedule 1, Class H. 
One of these flags, the EU flag,  can be flown because it is a flag of an international organisation of which the UK is a member. From 29th March 2019 this will no longer be the case. Therefore, in future consent must be required.
The government’s guidance in “Flying flags: a plain English guide” must also be updated to reflect this change.

attributes.action: Scrap the make taxation digital regulations for all business below £100k profit
attributes.background: The make tax digital regulations deliver no benefits to either HMRC or small business, especially those on cash accounting or low profit business. The additional burden will inevitably close or damage many business', &  the economy so the best solution would be to scrap it before it is too late
attributes.additional_details: The making tax digital regulations are fundamentally flawed and failed to take note of the consultation warnings of the impact they would have on in particular small business's, so instead of running a parallel trial where the uptake would be voluntary they have instead opted for closure of business and damage to the economy. Therefore the only safe solution is to scrap these for low profit business and make it voluntary instead so that those who see benefits can & others continue to file online

attributes.action: refund 2 months Road tax for every car driver, due to the amount of pot holes
attributes.background: We are paying road tax for roads that are not fit for us to drive on and this is causing damage to our vehicles and the cost lies with us the tax payer to repair our cars. if you are paying for a service the service that you are paying for sure be suitable and not value for money.
attributes.additional_details:
In order to address this situation I believe that the government should reduce the amount of road tax for next year as compensation or give back the equivalent of two months road tax to every car owner in the country.

If you paid for any of the service that wasn't fit for purpose you will be able to claim a refund why is this not the same with our Road tax

attributes.action: Ask the EU under Article 50(3) TFEU to extend the period before Brexit
attributes.background: Our future as a global trading nation hangs on our future relationship with the EU. That is far from certain and we need time to develop it. Once we leave the EU, our position will be weaker across the board. We should not  burn that bridge and move into the transition without more clarity.
attributes.additional_details: During the proposed transition, the UK will be a rule-taker, not a rule-maker. It will be able to sign – but not implement- trade agreements with partners outside the EU. There is no clear evidence of the availability, terms or value of such deals, and potential partners will wish to know the UK's future relationship with the EU before committing themselves. The Transition is too uncertain. We should not leave our existing terms with the EU before we are sure we are headed for a better future.

attributes.action: Don't allow councils to use private companies as Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.background: Councils are subcontracting their Enforcement Officers to private companies. It has been highlighted in the news and in a damning panorama report, private companies are out for profit and cannot make the right moral decisions. These powers need to remain with local council Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39882434

attributes.action: Improve mental healthcare provisions available for prisoners
attributes.background: Levels of mental health conditions amongst prisoners are disproportionately high compared to those in society.  Despite this, provisions available for prisoners are lacking and the prison environment itself can be a driving force which exacerbates a mental health condition opposed to combatting it.
attributes.additional_details:
90% of prisoners experience some form of mental health condition whilst in prison (Singleton et al., 1998) and acute disorders such as psychosis are extremely high (Bebbington et al., 2016).  Suicide and self harm rates are at an all time high (Fazel et al., 2017).
Whilst HMPPS and the NHS alongside the department of health provide "in reach teams" to help those suffering from a mental health condition, more needs to be done.

attributes.action: Make financial management a compulsory part of education in schools
attributes.background:
The national level of personal debt in this country is on the rise. It will only get worse unless something is done now.

Proper financial management has to be taught in schools from a young age to prepare children for the future.

This could be included in maths or done as a separate subject.
attributes.additional_details:
I work in local government, dealing with insolvency and large debts on a daily basis. I've seen so many cases where people clearly don't know how to manage their finances and need solid advice on how to budget.

National statistics for Individual Voluntary Arrangements (IVAs) show that they are steadily on the rise since their introduction. However, I've seen several terminted because people can't make enough sacrifices and stick to arrangements. This then leads to harsher financial penalties.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for vendors to produce a Home Survey prior to marketing
attributes.background:
I paid for 1 survey & vendors withdrew from market
Paid for survey on 2nd house & found pure asbestos
Paid for survey on 3rd house & found structural movement
Paid for survey to buy 4th house
And other buyers will also have to pay for surveys on those same houses.

attributes.action: Lower the math entry requirement to a Grade D, to access teacher training.
attributes.background: Many Passionate individuals like myself are not able to access teacher training courses due to receiving a grade D at GCSE level. This is creating a problem of shortages of teachers, since many are simply not able to active peruse their dreams in helping the younger generation achieve their best.
attributes.additional_details: Why would you need math to teach English, Sociology or other non math based/ limited math courses. It seems that achieving a Grade D in math at GCSE portrays the idea that we cannot do math. This is absolutely absurd, just because people did not achieve a grade C or above does not mean we cannot do the basic math. I simply believe, to become a teacher within the UK, math should only be a requirement depending on the type of Course the individual would like to teach.

attributes.action: Allow fast food delivery drivers access to bus lanes during operating hours.
attributes.background: As the majority of bus lanes restrict public traffic from travelling along them between 7am-7pm, a lot of fast food takeaways deliver within these hours and delivery drivers are commonly stuck in traffic during rush hour. This results in orders arriving late, negative customer reviews etc.
attributes.additional_details: A simple suggestion to put this into perspective would be to allow employers to distribute e.g. Plates, stickers to their employees vehicles to easily identify that they are eligible and to also prevent the misuse of bus lanes.

attributes.action: Remove defensive architecture to help homeless people sleep safely
attributes.background: We undersign our HM Government to make it illegal for businesses and local communities to have defensive architecture on their buildings and benches. This is so that homeless people can have somewhere to sleep safely at night, without being harmed

attributes.action: Restrict social media use by children to help prevent cyberbullying
attributes.background:
We urge Parliament to consider new laws, banning the posting of content to social media / video-sharing sites by under-18s. 

Children should be focussed on developing real life social skills, and deserve a childhood free from the pressures and bullying which go hand in hand with social media use.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media / video-sharing websites are often used as a way to bully other children, and in some cases teachers too, something from which the victim has no opportunity to escape, even at home.

Children should not be posting content online, until they have reached an age at which they have been fully educated about its use/misuse, can understand the emotional damage bullying online may cause, and the legal ramifications of broadcasting inappropriate content or making libelous remarks online.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Mental illness in the South Asian and Islamic communities
attributes.background: We would like the government to intervene and educate community leaders, to prevent further stigma and abuse received by South Asians and particularly muslims who suffer from mental health issues, which results in mental health abuse, due to lack of intelligence in the subject by those in authority.

attributes.action: Make Recycling Compulsory
attributes.background: The united kingdom is falling behind on the amount of recycling compared to other European countries. We could fix this by making recycling compulsory, a tax reduction (similar to charity donations) and education for younger generations that will encourage new generations to recycle more often.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom is falling behind on recycling rates compared to other developed nations such as France and Germany causing 60% of waste going to landfill. This needs to change. I propose that we can end this through making recycling compulsory, through methods such as: an increase tax for if landfill waste increases, a tax reduction for companies that increase the percentage recycled, similar to charity donations and encouraging new generations to recycle through education within schools.

attributes.action: Set a minimum price per calorie for unhealthy foods
attributes.background: People have become accustomed to eating foods such as fast food, chocolate, sweets etc. These are unnecessarily high in calories and, as a result, directly fuel the obesity crisis. A minimum price per calorie would force these foods to be made with the same taste and far fewer calories.
attributes.additional_details:
Suggestion: 1p per calorie.  

E.g. In order to sell a typical fast food lunch of currently 1000 calories would cost a prohibitive £10.  In order to sell the same meal for £5, fast food chains would be forced to create the same, good tasting meal for only 500 calories.

attributes.action: Reform the law on incarcerating drug addicts, introducing harm reduction clinics
attributes.background: The 'Harm Reduction' drug policy used in Switzerland in the 1980's  has had a range of positive impacts on addicts, and should be used in the UK.Two-Thirds of the addicts who entered the harm-reduction clinics found full time jobs as they did not spend their time and money financing their addiction.
attributes.additional_details:
- http://vancouver.ca/people-programs/four-pillars-drug-strategy.aspx
 - https://www.globalcommissionondrugs.org/the-hardline-approach-to-drugs-must-end-by-richard-branson/
- http://www.smh.com.au/comment/swiss-recipe-for-dealing-with-drug-addiction-proves-a-success-20130622-2opcj.html

The benefits that addicts can receive from the harm reduction strategy hugely outweighs the 'positives' brought by the more traditional, hard-line policy that punishes and incarcerates addicts which inevitably worsens their addiction and leaves them stripped of opportunities when released.

attributes.action: Change the law to protect parental contributions for house purchase on divorce
attributes.background: 1000s of parents are donating money to their son or daughter’s house purchases. Parents are providing part or all of the large deposits required in today’s inflated UK housing market. Currently there is no law protecting these funds in the event of a divorce and the Government needs to address this.
attributes.additional_details:
Families are providing funds believing this money will stay with their children or indeed their grandchildren further down the line in the event of a divorce. This is not the case. Declaration of Trusts or similar deeds are ignored by judges and the non-contributing partner is wrongly benefitting.
Legal protection is needed to stop these contributions and inheritances disappearing from the original families.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory 6 weeks Comunity Service for 18-year-olds
attributes.background: There are some 750,000 18-year-olds in the UK. Their service to our nation would not only be an invaluable help to our understaffed, overstretched national health and education services but would also reestablish the commitment and responsibility we, as individuals, feel towards our community.
attributes.additional_details: Our nation’s young adults are able to bring the energy, enthusiasm and hard work to revitalize our public service sectors. Driving ambulances, escorting elderly patients to and from medical procedures and helping out in the classroom (with the necessary background checks); these six weeks would provide not only an immense service to our country but also an ideological grounding for its citizens. The UK is experiencing a time of increasing social divide in which our people feel estranged from the nation as a whole. Working hands-on with members of our community would deepen our understanding of our society and revolutionize the role we feel we play in it. An elevated feeling of responsibly towards our society will prove imperative to its success.

attributes.action: Make snow days in school a legal requirement when snowfall is over 2 inches.
attributes.background: I believe that england doesn't see much snow and when it does the children in schools need time to appreciate it. Maybe they could dabble in winter sports or just have a simple snowball fight. It can als be dangerous to get children to school as the roads will become icy and dangerous for driving.

attributes.action: Stop change 4 life's campaign on healthy eating and lifestyle
attributes.background: Change 4 life's campaign for a healthy lifestyle is supposedly trying to help children. However, exposing nutritional values to children or such young ages can become a main cause of developing an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details:
Children and young adolescents should be able to enjoy a carefree childhood without the pressure of obsessing over the things they eat. Everything in moderation is healthy and children should be encouraged to believe this. Eating disorders are on the rise but yet this campaign is still choosing to fuel them and ignore the high mortality rate
 as a result of these illness'.

attributes.action: A UK wide once in a generation special Public Holiday to clear the UK of Litter
attributes.background: I would like to propose a once in a generation special public holiday to get everyone outside with recycled bin bags & litter pickers to help clear & tidy up their local areas from the unsightly litter that we all come across from day to day but never have the time to do it.  The UK is beautiful!
attributes.additional_details: Since I was a child I always remember thinking why do people throw their litter out of cars or discard it whilst walking.  It is something that I really feel strongly about. so what can I do about it?  I could spend my time endlessly picking after people. Or better still encourage everyone to do it!

attributes.action: Black Ancient History to be taught in schools. As a course, module, in all level
attributes.background: In school the only recollection of any study about Africa, was based upon African colonisation, and pro independence; this was fine, until I started to come across information about African Ancient History post university, by myself, with the help of the internet. I felt overwhelmed and shocked.
attributes.additional_details:
I did Politics and International Relations Degree.

Nevertheless missing African Ancient history is like missing a huge chunk of world history.

If the following is included in the educational system, it would be great. Information about.....

- Nubia



- Songhai

- Lost African Kings and Queens such  as: Nefertiti, Sheba, Hannibal

- Kemet

- Ashanti

- Moors (when blacks ruled Spain)

 -Benin Empire(1180-1897 CE) , Mali Empire (1235-1600 CE) , Ghana Empire (700-1240 CE)

+ more

attributes.action: Full-time employees to receive £100 bonus a month if they have no sickness
attributes.background: People who work full time, pay bills, have no help and have little left per month should be rewarded with a £100 incentive. This would make people working full time feel appreciated. The Government are helping the wrong people and its time for full-time workers to have a reward.

attributes.action: International British Medical Students should be funded by the Government (SFE).
attributes.background: NHS has a massive shortage of doctors. British Medical Students studying in international universities have to take on great financial burdens to achieve their dreams of becoming doctors. These students are then coming back to the UK to support our NHS. So, shouldn't the government support them!
attributes.additional_details: Student Finance England (SFE) should support British Medical Students studying in European or International Medical Universities.  NHS has a massive shortage of doctors. British Medical Students studying in international universities have to take on great financial burdens to achieve their dreams of becoming doctors. These students are then coming back to the UK to support our NHS. So, shouldn't the government support them! These students are the backbone of the NHS!
